All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
BattleShipConsoleView
Console view for battleship, no powerups Stopped development to work on javafx battleship
BattleshipGUI
This is the main class, sets all of the views, intitialzes game, etc
Board
This class holds the ships, allows shots to be fired, and gives the game vital information about win states, etc.
Coord
A simple Point class to store two integers that represent the row and column of a Tic Tac Toe board
CurrencyBank
This is the player's bank account that contains the in-game currency for the power-up system.
Game
Usage example: Game game = new Game(strategy); game.shoot(4,3); if (game.hasPlayerWon()) // do something else game.nextTurn();
GameModeView
Start view of the game, user can choose difficulty and powerups, and is then redirected to placeshipsview
HardAI
This AI loops through all of the ships on your board and looks for any that are hit but not completely sunk.
OurObservable
A simple observable class use to notify observers of any state change in the the observable.
OurObserver
This interface must be implemented by any observer that wants to be notified of ant change to the state of the model.
PlaceShipsView
This is the view in which the user places ships byy dragging and dropping
PlayDrawingView
Playdrawingview is a drawing view of the game of battleship, ships are drawn in as images, ships have already been placed, and the user can click to make shots.
PowerUp
This class defines the Power-Up shots that the user can spend in-game currency on that will allow them to hit more spaces on the board.
RandomAI
This class uses a board to get moves for the computer player
Ship_Four
 
Ship_One
 
Ship_Three
 
Ship_Two
 
Ships
Ships are the objects in battleship used to determine if ship has been shot, whether the entire ship has been shot, and eventually whether the game has been won.
SimpleTextView
 
Strategy
Interface for strategies: must be able to get a move given a board
